text: Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed (13 May 1905 – 11 February 1977) was the fifth President of India from 1974 to 1977 and also the 2nd President of India to die in office.Former Presidents President of India website.Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed (1905–1977): Biography RRTC, Ministry of Information and Broadcasting. ==Early life== Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed was born on 13 May 1905 at the Hauz Qazi area of Old Delhi, India.He met Jawaharlal Nehru in England in 1925. He joined the Indian National Congress. He actively participated in the Indian freedom movement. In 1942 he was arrested in the Quit India movement. He was send to prison for 3 1/2 years as punishment by the British rule. He was a member of the Assam Pradesh Congress Committee from 1936. He was the member of All India Congress Committee from 1947 to 1974. ==As President== Fakhruddin was chosen for the President election by Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 1974. In 20 August 1974, he was elected as the President of India.He became the second Muslim to be elected as the President. He was the second Indian president to die in office. He died on 11 February 1977 due to a heart attack, at the age of 72. ==References== * Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed, by M. A. Naidu, 1975 * Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed, by Attar Chand. Pub. Homeland, 1975. * ==Other websites== * Legends of Assam * Fifth Lok Sabha Members Official Bioprofile Category:Presidents of India Category:1905 births Category:1977 deaths Category:Politicians from Assam Category:Members of the Lok Sabha Category:Indian National Congress politicians
title: Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed
